means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 布彻职业名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“屠夫”(butcher)

sentence.Network_en: Klaus Barbie was known in France as the Butcher of Lyon.
sentence.Network_cn: 在法国，克劳斯·巴比是臭名昭著的“里昂屠夫”。

sentence.Network_en: Ask the butcher for soup bones (marrow bones are best).
sentence.Network_cn: 跟肉铺老板要煲汤用的骨头（最好是髓骨）。

sentence.Network_en: The butcher's son called out a greeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 屠夫的儿子大声打了个招呼。

lj.lj_ly: let's take a butcher's at those bugs.
lj.lj_ls: 让我们看看那些甲虫吧。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French bochier, from boc 'he-goat', probably of the same ultimate origin as buck

entry.def: A butcher is a shopkeeper who cuts up and sells meat. Some butchers also kill animals for meat and make foods such as sausages and meat pies.
A butcher or a butcher's is a shop where meat is sold.
To butcher an animal means to kill it and cut it up for meat.

example.ex: Pigs were butchered, hams were hung to dry from the ceiling.
example.tran: 杀了猪，猪腿挂在天花板上风干。

entry.def: You can refer to someone as a butcher when they have killed a lot of people in a very cruel way, and you want to express your horror and disgust.

example.ex: Klaus Barbie was known in France as the Butcher of Lyon.
example.tran: 在法国，克劳斯·巴比是臭名昭著的“里昂屠夫”。

entry.def: You can say that someone has butchered people when they have killed a lot of people in a very cruel way, and you want to express your horror and disgust.

example.ex: Our people are being butchered in their homes.
example.tran: 我们的人民在自己家里遭到了屠杀。

means.word_mean: 3. a person who slaughters or dresses meat for market
4. someone who makes mistakes because of incompetence

sentences.sentence: "They slaughtered their only goat to survive the winter"

auth_sentence.content: This butcher says his profit margins are way down.
auth_sentence.res_content: This butcher says his profit margins are way down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This butcher says his profit margins are way down.

auth_sentence.content: Even our butcher in London doesn't charge that.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even our butcher in London doesn't charge that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even our butcher in London doesn't charge that.

auth_sentence.content: Butcher was still beside himself at the accolade yesterday.
auth_sentence.res_content: Butcher was still beside himself at the accolade yesterday.

means.word_mean: 屠夫, 肉商, 肉贩

sentences.en: Mother went to the butcher's yesterday.
He was as great a butcher as the world has been.
sentences.cn: 他是有史以来最大的杀人狂。

sentences.en: He butchered the pig with a small sharp knife.
sentences.cn: 他用一把锋利的小刀杀猪。

jushi.english: Mother went to the butcher's yesterday.
Her husband is a fat butcher.
jushi.chinese: 她的丈夫是个胖胖的屠夫。
